parameters.name: InstanceChargeType
parameters.description:
The billing method of the instance. Valid values:

*   PostPaid: pay-as-you-go.
*   PrePaid: subscription.

Default value: PostPaid.

parameters.name: InstanceType
parameters.description: The instance type of the capacity reservation. You can specify this parameter to query only effective capacity reservations. To query capacity reservations that are released, you must specify PrivatePoolOptions.Ids.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description:
The maximum number of entries per page.

Maximum value: 100

Default value: 10.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You must specify the token that is obtained from the previous query as the value of the NextToken parameter.

parameters.name: Platform
parameters.description:
The operating system of the instance. Valid values:

*   windows: Windows operating systems.
*   linux: Linux operating systems.
*   all: all operating system types.

Default value: all.

parameters.name: PrivatePoolOptions.Ids
parameters.description: The IDs of capacity reservations. The value can be a JSON array that consists of up to 100 capacity reservation IDs. Separate the IDs with commas (,).

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID of the capacity reservation. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~25609~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description:
The ID of the resource group to which the capacity reservation belongs. If you specify this parameter to query resources, up to 1,000 resources that belong to the specified resource group can be displayed in the response.

> Resources in the default resource group are displayed in the response regardless of whether you specify this parameter.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The status of the capacity reservation. Valid values:

*   All: All states.
*   Pending: The capacity reservation is being initialized. Scheduled capacity reservations enter the Pending state after they are created.
*   Preparing: The capacity reservation is being prepared. Scheduled capacity reservations are in the Preparing state while resources are being provisioned.
*   Prepared: The capacity reservation is to take effect. After resources are provisioned, scheduled capacity reservations remain in the Prepared state until they take effect.
*   Active: The capacity reservation is in effect.
*   Released: The capacity reservation is manually or automatically released when it expires.

If you do not specify this parameter, capacity reservations in states other than Pending and Released are queried.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description: The tags of the capacity reservation.

parameters.name: ZoneId
parameters.description: The zone ID of the capacity reservation.
